page.title: 04Kippax Church (cont)
page.content: The walls of the church are of herringbone masonry thought to be Saxon. There is more of this type of masonry in Kippax church than in any other church in the country with the exception of Burghwallis near Doncaster. The porch is not bonded to the original building it was possible added in the 18th century. The rectangular measures 13'2" East to West and 11'0" North to South. It contains too deep splayed round headed windows which have been renewed on the outside. The tower contains a ring of six bells including 3 old ones dated 1636 and 1638. These were later re_cast and re_hung along with new ones in 1946.
